definition: to have dark circles under one's eyes/to have eyes like a panda
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Miki came, I saw him the spirit of the poor, with two black eye.
sentences.chinese: 美树过来时，我看见他的精神很差，带着两个熊猫眼。

sentences.english: I got sent home from school one day with a shiner on my eye.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我带着一只熊猫眼被学校踢回了家。

sentences.english: Unexpectatively my panda eye does so.
sentences.chinese: 想不到我的熊猫眼就这么练成了。

sentences.english: Today, my girlfriend actually walked into a door and gave herself a black eye.
sentences.chinese: 今天我女朋友不小心在门上撞成了熊猫眼。

sentences.english: It's really important that your concealer makeup completely matches your foundation to avoid panda eyes.
sentences.chinese: 用遮瑕妆和眼部化妆来避免熊猫眼真的很主要。

definition: puffiness under the eyes/bags under the eyes
plump lower eyelids (considered to be an attractive feature)
to stay up late or all night
grumpiness associated with poor sleep/irritability in the morning
